info.name: victoria-connect-api
info.description:
Right levels and their equivelent HTTP methods.

Right level | HTTP method
------------|------------
`full`      | * (any)
`delete`    | `DELETE`
`create`    | `POST`
`write`     | `PATCH`
`read`      | `GET`

`full` implies `write`, `create` and `delete`.
`write` implies `read`.

request.description:
Get API's health status.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous user.

Generate a 404 not found response.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous user.

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: X-Powered-By
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

request.description:
Exchange username/mail address + password for an access token + refresh token.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous user.

header.name: Authorization
header.description: Basic authorization client:secret. Any input accepted really.

request.description:
Exchange refresh token for a new access token + refresh token.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous user.

header.description: Basic authorization client:secret. Any input accepted really.

originalRequest.description: Exchange refresh token for a new access token + refresh token.

request.description:
Destroy the access token (and refresh token). In UI terms, this is analogus to logging out.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated user.

Send a mail address confirmation mail to the mail address specified with `{{user_address_mail}}`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): Anonymous user.

Confirm a `user`'s mail address.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous user.

Get detailed information about your own `user` entity.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated user.

Returns:

* `user` (detail)

Get information about a `user`.

Returns detailed information when requesting information on your own `user` account. Returns minimal information (like name) otherwise.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated user.

Returns:

* `user` (detail)

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

request.description:
Update `user` account data.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated user, self.

Returns:

* `user` (detail)

Send an mail with password reset link to all email addresses associated with the `user` matching `{{user_address_mail}}`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous user.

Change / reset the `user`'s password using either the current password or a password reset token.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous user.

Retrieve stub information on a `portal` by `domain`. The stub should contain enough information to create a branded login screen.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous user.

Returns:

* `portal` (stub)

Retrieve detailed information on the `portal` associated with the current `user`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated user.

Returns:

* `portal` (detail)

Retrieve detailed information on a `portal` by `portal.id` (normal way).

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated user associated with the portal.

Returns:

* `portal` (detail)

Update (partial information of) a `portal`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `portal.write`.

Returns:

* `portal` (detail)

Get a list of `check` stubs containing just enough information to create an overview page.
Will only expose checks that are available to the `portal`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated user.

Returns:

* `check` (stub)

Retrieve detailed information on a `check`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated user.

Returns:

* `check` (detail)

Creates a new `group`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `group.create` on parent `portal`'s main group (`portal.group.id`).

Returns:

* `group` (detail)

Get a list of `group` stubs containing just enough information to create an overview page.

Returns:

* `group` (stub)

Retrieve detailed information on a `group`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): any.

Returns:

* `group` (detail)
* `user` (stub)

Update (partial information of) a `group`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `group.write`.

Returns:

* `group` (detail)

Delete a `group`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `group.delete`.

Returns:

* `group` (detail)

Creates a new screening `profile`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `profile.create`.

Returns:

* `profile` (detail)

Get a list of screening `profile` stubs containing just enough information to create an overview page.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `profile.read`.

Returns:

* `profile` (stub)

Get a list of screening `profile` stubs containing just enough information to create an overview page.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `profile.read`.

Returns:

* `profile` (stub)

Retrieve detailed information on a screening `profile`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `profile.read`.

Returns:

* `profile` (detail)

Update part of a screening `profile`, like the title and checks.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `profile.write`.

Returns:

* `profile` (detail)

Make a duplicate of a screening `profile`. Returns the newly created screening `profile`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `profile.create`.

Returns:

* `profile` (detail)

Delete a screening `profile`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `profile.delete`.

Returns:

* `profile` (detail)

Creates a new `screening`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screening.create`.

Returns:

* `screening` (detail)

Get a list of `screening` stubs containing just enough information to create an overview page.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screening.read`.

Returns:

* `screening` (stub)
* `profile` (stub)
* `screenee` (stub, tentative)

Retrieve detailed information on a `screening`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screening.read`.

Returns:

* `screening` (detail)
* `profile` (detail)

Update part of a `screening`, like the title, or the start and end date.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screening.write`.

Returns:

* `screening` (detail)

Delete a `screening`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screening.delete`.

Returns:

* `screening` (detail)

Invites a new `screenee`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screenee.create`.

Returns:

* `screenee` (detail)

Get a list of `screenee` stubs containing just enough information to create an overview page.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screenee.read`.

Returns:

* `screenee` (stub)
* `user` (minimal)

Retrieve detailed information on a `screenee`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screenee.read`.

Returns:

* `screenee` (detail)
* `user` (minimal)

Resend the invitation mail to the `screenee`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screenee.read`.

Returns:

HTTP 200 on success.

Update part of a `screenee`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screenee.write`.

Returns:

* `screenee` (detail)

Remove a `screenee`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screenee.delete`.

Returns:

* `screenee` (detail)

Get a list of `screenee` stubs containing just enough information to create an overview page.

The overview page is from the `group`'s perspective. Effectively a list of `screenee`s associated with the `group`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screenee.read`.

Returns:

* `screenee` (stub)
* `user` (minimal)

Retrieve detailed information on a `screenee` (regardless of `screening` context).

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screenee.read`.

Returns:

* `screenee` (detail)
* `user` (minimal)

Remove `screenee` information.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screenee.delete`.

Returns:

* `screenee` (detail)

Checks the state of a `screenee` invite token.

This request has 3 potential responses:

* HTTP 404: The invite token is invalid, or the `screenee` does not exist.

* HTTP 200: The invite token is valid, but no `user` was found matching the email address of the `screenee`. The `screenee` prolly needs to register a new `user` account whilest supplying the invite token.

* HTTP 200: The invite token is valid, and a `user` was found who's email address matches that of the `screenee`. The `screenee` prolly needs to sign in (if not signed in already), and make a call to `LINK screenee/:screenee_id/invite/:screenee_invite_token/`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous.

Returns:

* `group` (stub)
* `screening` (stub)
* `screenee` (minimal)
* `user` (minimal)

Creates a new `user` account, if the invite token is valid. On success, links the `screenee` to the `user` account.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous.

Returns:

* `user` (detail)
* `screenee` (list)

Links the `screenee` to the current `user`, there by accepting the invite.

No need to call this API end-point if using the invite token to register a new `user` account.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated user.

Returns:

* `screenee` (stub)
* `user` (minimal)

Declines the invitation.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous.

Returns:

HTTP 200 on success.

Get a list of `screenee` stubs containing just enough information to create an overview page.

The overview page is from the screenee's perspective. Effectively a list of `screening`s of which you are a `screenee`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated user.

Returns:

* `screenee` (stub)
* `screening` (stub)
* `profile` (stub)

Retrieve information on a `screenee`.

This is from the `screenee`'s perspective. Effectively showing the `screening` of which you are the `screenee`.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated user.

Returns:

* `screenee` (stub)
* `screening` (stub)
* `profile` (stub)

Generates a QR-code.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated user.

Returns the name of the current step in the process.

Possible values:

* `token`: Waiting for a token to be requested.
* `start`: Waiting for the application to connect.
* `data.receive`: Waiting for data from the identification app.
* `data.release`: Waiting for release of data to HR.
* `end`: Check has ended.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated `user` associated with the `screenee`.

Generates a token which can be used to make requests without a conventional access token.

This token is used by the mobile identification app to send data to the API, and used by the request that releases the data to HR.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated `user` associated with the `screenee`.

Tests the token by making a connection.

This is used by the mobile identification app and allows the portal to advance.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous user, using a token.

Upload and check ID information.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous user, using a token.

Remove the information previously gathered.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): authenticated `user` associated with the `screenee`.

Remove the information previously gathered; from the perspective of HR.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): `screenee.write`.

Releases the previously gathered information to HR.

This request requires **the same token** used to upload the data.

Minimum permission required (implied or explicit): anonymous user, using a token.
